required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Haplo SCT vs Haplo-cord SCT for Patients With Hematological Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Haplo-identical Stem Cell Transplantation Versus Haplo-cord Stem Cell Transplantation for Patients With Hematological Disorders

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: Patients who have hematological disorders and will undergo haplo-identical donor stem cell transplantation (haplo SCT) are candidates of this trial. Participants will randomized into two arms: Arm A will undergo a typical haplo SCT, while Arm B will receive an co-infusion of an unrelated cord blood unit (haplo-cord SCT) in addition to Arm A. Overall survival, progression-free survival, nonrelapse mortality and cumulative incidence of relapse will be recorded and endpoints.

primary_outcome.description: estimated overall survival at 3 year post-SCT

secondary_outcome.description: estimated progression-free survival at 3 year post-SCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of non-relapse mortality from SCT
secondary_outcome.description: estimated nonrelapse mortality at 3 year post-SCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of relapse from SCT
secondary_outcome.description: estimated cumulative incidence of nonrelapse mortality at 3 year post-SCT

arm_group.description: people enrolled in this arm will receive a typical haplo-identical donor SCT
people enrolled in this arm will receive a co-infusion of cord blood unit in addition to a typical haplo-identical donor SCT

intervention.description: SCT will be performed with a haplo-identical donor
Haplo-identical donor SCT will be performed with co-infusion of unrelated cord blood unit

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University
